info.game_comments:
2007 College Championship quarterfinal game 3.
From the University of Southern California.

(1, 1).clue: Peter Goldmark rocked his way in for his invention of this type of record album, "LP" for short

(2, 1).clue: I'll take the Loop & go to the Field Museum if it's not too windy in this city

(3, 1).clue: Seen here is a marriage contract written in this language, the same one in which Jesus preached

(4, 1).clue: Get out your binoculars: 121 species of these have been spotted on the campus of Bennington

(5, 1).clue: "Grindhouse" is a double feature written by Robert Rodriguez & this director of "Pulp Fiction"

(6, 1).clue: With an initial W, it's done to necks & wet rags; without one, it's done to bells

(1, 2).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew stands next to a monitor.) Biotech pioneer Leroy Hood mapped his place in the Hall with an automated technique for sequencing fragments of this molecule

(2, 2).clue: I'll get some cash at the First Bank of the United States so I can buy a cheese steak in this city

(3, 2).clue: Written on papyrus, 21 books of the New Testament were these formal instructive letters

(4, 2).clue: Grab your camera & major in Documentary Studies at CSF, the College of this New Mexico City

(5, 2).clue: This actor really sings the faux '80s song "Pop! Goes My Heart" on the "Music and Lyrics" soundtrack

(6, 2).clue: Pirates' plunder, or an item of baby footwear

(1, 3).clue: Allen Breed rode in with his invention of these quick-deploying car-safety devices he first thought of back in 1968

(2, 3).clue: I'll hum through the Motown Historical Museum in this city

(3, 3).clue: Seen here is a detail from this book of mortuary spells that helped the deceased get to the Field of Reeds

(4, 3).clue: The devil you say! The logo seen here belongs to this university

(5, 3).clue: Shia LaBeouf discovers that "every killer lives next door to someone" in this 2007 horror film

(6, 3).clue: A pronoun, or a song like "Alas! And Did My Savior Bleed?"

(2, 4).clue: At Nordstrom's flagship store, I'll buy shoes so I can walk the Pacific Science Center in this city

(3, 4).clue: A papyrus copy of "Constitution of Athens" by this tutor of Alexander the Great was discovered in 1890

(4, 4).clue: At Juilliard, not drama but this other "d"ivision requires students to take courses in anatomy & partnering

(5, 4).clue: Rainn Wilson co-stars in this 2007 film about what happens after 2 siblings find a mysterious box of toys

(6, 4).clue: Ending in -ue, it helps a detective find a killer; ending in -ew, it was thread that led the way out of a classic maze

(1, 5).clue: Arthur Nobile made the list for prednisone & prednisolone, 2 of these drugs used as anti-inflammatories

(2, 5).clue: I'll stroll in Centennial Olympic Park in this city

(3, 5).clue: The papyrus raft seen here, the "Ra II", was used by this Norwegian anthropologist and explorer

(4, 5).clue: Bryn Mawr is Welsh for "high hill", but Bryn Mawr isn't in Wales; it's in this U.S. state

(5, 5).clue: In its native Mexico, this Oscar-winning film was called "El Laberinto del Fauno"

(6, 5).clue: A participle for one who has reached adulthood, or a sound of misery on hearing a bad pun

(1, 1).clue: G'day! (You need more?!) / A Tasmanian devil / Is this too easy?

(2, 1).clue: This macho author's "The Short Happy Life of Francis Macomber" tells of a couple on safari in Kenya

(3, 1).clue: He accepted Robert E. Lee's surrender at Appomattox Court House

(4, 1).clue: "Hanging ten" means riding at the front of your board with these off it

(6, 1).clue: Santa Rosa is a large, dark purple variety of this fruit

(1, 2).clue: Hapsburgs' empire / Low-lying Neusiedler Lake / Hey, Schwarzenegger!

(2, 2).clue: "The Dead" is the longest of the 15 short stories in this 1914 James Joyce collection

(3, 2).clue: He was a movie star & president of the Screen Actors Guild
